title: ISic020551. ISic020551
body:

Î¼ ğ…‚Â´Î™Î™Î™Î™Â´ Î»ÎµÌ„ÎºÏ…Î¸Î¯Î´ÎµÏ‚ Î—Î”Î”Â´

Apparatus criticus

Text after Arena (IGASM 2)

English translation

One drachma and four obols: (price of) 120 lekythoi.

Italian translation

Una dracma e quattro oboli: (prezzo di) 120 lekythoi (transl. by Arena 2002).

commentary

Inscription in clear letters under the foot of an intact pelike, depicting a scene with Dionysus and a satyr. The first interpretation of the text is due to Halbherr (referred to by Orsi 1906), who interpreted Î»ÎµÌ„ÎºÏ…Î¸Î¯Î´ÎµÏ‚ as a measure followed by the number twenty Î”Î” (Orsi also reads this way, while Arena corrects with Î—Î”Î”). Again according to Halbherr, the preceding number, indicated in accordance with the Attic system, should be read as 'ten thousand and one drachma and four obols'. Arena (see translation, which we accept) assumes a correspondence between the two values.

bibliography

    Arena 2002 81 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001373 Orsi 1906 368-370, fig. 272, pl. 16 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002679
